lexs:SystemIdentifier.nc:OrganizationName: New Mexico Department of Public Safety

nc:Activity.nc:ActivityDescriptionText: On 3/12/1997 at 12:01 a.m., Mr. Donald R. Duck (Witness 1) saw a white male break the glass of his neighbor's (Jacob Joe) front door. Mr. Duck placed a 911 call on his cell phone to report the incident. Within minutes, police arrived at the residence (1 NW Brockway Avenue) to find the subject ransacking the house. Officer Bond was the responding officer. Upon seeing Officer Bond and Officer Bond Identifying himself as an officer, the subject darted out a back window with a black gunny sac in hand and disappeared into the night. Upon review of the exit point, 2 (one left and one right) size 10 Red Wing boot impressions were found leaving the window area (casting taken). In addition, a man's black leather wallet containing a Diner Club Card, Public Library Card, a condom and a New Mexico Concealed Weapon Permit. All documents were issued to one Thomas C. Farr, SSN: 968526352, permit number G8251, expiration 1/26/2002. When questioning the Victim, Victim indicated that he knew Mr. Farr. They had once been step siblings. Apparently, the victims mother and step father had divorced some time ago, victim estimated eight years earlier. Victim indicated the subject had been an acquaintance since 1980, but there is no reason that Mr. Farr should have been on the victims property. Victim will provide a list of missing property.

On March 18, 1997, Mr. Thomas C. Farr (white, male, SSN: 968526352) came into the office and indicated that he wished to renew his offender registration saying that he could not remember when it expired, but he did not want to abscond from his duties. Per procedure, I ran Mr. Farr through our system to verify his need to register. As a part of that check, I found that a warrant had been issued for Mr. Farr on a burglary offense and a flight to avoid offense. As a result of this warrant, I placed Mr. Farr under arrest. Mr. Farr indicated that he had not stolen anything in his life. He did indicate that he had recovered some things that belonged to him from his brother's residence, but that was only after many attempts to have his brother return to him what was rightfully his. He indicated that the necklace he was wearing was one of the retreived items as was a firearm later recovered from his residence. When asked about the other items listed as stolen on the theft report, Mr. Farr indicated he didn't know anything about them and insited that he only took what was his.

j:Witness.j:WitnessAccountDescriptionText: Saw an older white male break a front door window and enter into a neighbor's house. Called 911 for assistance.

j:RegisteredOffender.j:RegisteredOffenderReportingCriteriaTex: Must report annually to Santa Fe PD.

j:Witness.j:WitnessAccountDescriptionText: Responded to burglary call from dispatcher. Arrived at residence at 12:25 a.m. to find the front door standing open with the glass broken out. I drew my weapon and entered the structure. Proceeding through the entry way and entered the kitchen hearing loud noise in back, up-stairs portion of the residence. I proceeded up the back stairs where I encountered subject going through a jewelry box at the end of the hallway. Startling the subject (white, male, black clothes, and gloves), he dropped the jewelry box and exited through an exterior window. I immediately went down stairs and out the kitchen door expecting to find the subject, but only found some foot prints and a wallet containing a condom, Diner Club Card, Library Card, and a Conceal Weapon Permit All identification had the name Thomas C. Farr appearing on it.

nc:TangibleItem.nc:ItemDescriptionText: Permit to carry; Exp 2002-01-26 State of New Mexico issuing authority.
Black Leather Belt, with 6 inch PBR buckle. The buckle reads, "1992 World Champion".

nc:Substance.nc:ItemDescriptionText: 2 (one left and one right) size 10 Red Wing boot impressions were found leaving the window area only partial right heel print.

nc:TangibleItem.nc:ItemDescriptionText: The first published Punisher in a comic book.
